name: Emon Roy Bappy
headline: Research and Development Engineer at Cybernetics Hi-Tech Solutions
summary: My background in Mechanical Engineering from Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology has accelerated my passion for electromechanical systems. I have a strong foundation in Military Robotics and Bio‑Inspired Soft Robotics with extensive experience in computer‑aided design, printed circuit board design, finite element analysis, fused deposition modeling, molding, composite manufacturing, and CNC manufacturing processes. Currently, I am passionately pursuing opportunities to advance soft robotics in healthcare applications.

projects.title: Finite Element Analysis
projects.description: The Finite Element Analysis (FEA) of a 6-Degree-of-Freedom (DOF) Robotic Arm...
projects.longDescription: The Finite Element Analysis (FEA) of a 6-Degree-of-Freedom (DOF) Robotic Arm was conducted to evaluate its structural integrity, stress distribution, and deformation under various load conditions. The arm, designed to carry a 20 kg payload in a retracted position and 9 kg when fully extended, is constructed from aluminum and stainless steel to optimize strength and weight efficiency. A key feature of this arm is its self-collision avoidance system, which prevents interference between components during operation. The FEA was performed using ANSYS Static Analysis Software, incorporating nonlinear constraints, and a minimum factor of safety of 5 was maintained throughout. The analysis led to 8 design iterations, with adjustments to material selection and dimensions based on the simulation results. This process helped identify stress concentrations, potential failure points, and areas for structural optimization, ensuring the arm meets the required performance standards. Challenges addressed included simulating real-world operational constraints and balancing strength with weight reduction.

sections.heading: Overview
sections.text: We evaluated structural integrity, stress distribution, and deflection across critical poses. A self‑collision avoidance system was integrated at the kinematic level to prevent interference between links. Nonlinear constraints were included where necessary.
sections.caption: FEA setup — constraints and load application

sections.heading: Loads & Boundary Conditions
sections.text: Base mounting plate fixed, payload forces at the end‑effector along gravity and off‑axis directions to simulate dynamic scenarios. Joint interfaces modeled with contact and constraints.
sections.caption: Post‑processing — stress distribution

sections.heading: Meshing Strategy & Results
sections.text: Refined mesh at fillets, bolt interfaces, and section transitions. Convergence study ensured peak von Mises stress stability and tip deflection within tolerance.
sections.caption: Model and mesh refinement

iterations: Thickened high‑stress links and reduced mass on low‑stress members
Material change to stainless on select brackets with low fatigue margins
Fillet optimization to reduce stress concentrations
Reinforced mounting points; verified bolt patterns
outcomes: FoS ≥ 5 achieved across critical load cases

experience.description: With my expertise in Finite Element Analysis, manufacturing processes, and Fused Deposition Modeling, I contribute significantly to the optimization of robotic structures. My competencies ensure that the robots are designed to be both robust and efficient, thereby enabling them to perform the rigorous tasks required in military applications.
Managed suspension sub-team and led projects for 1 year 8 months.
Worked as a team member in suspension sub-team.
Oversaw society activities and led the team.
Worked on cutting-edge robotics projects during a year-long internship.
Acquired knowledge of three-wheeler manufacturing, automation, and process optimization.

experience.position: Project Leader of Electrical and Communications sub-team
experience.description: Led the electrical and communications sub-team in international space-robotics competitions.

experience.position: Member of Electrical and Communications Sub-team
experience.description: Contributed to electrical and communications tasks for team projects.
